Police said the inquiry was being moved from the Metropolitan Police's counter-terrorism command and would now be led by a specialist crime unit. This work will be carried out by the specialist crime directorate which has been investigating a related phone hacking allegation since September 2010, said the police. The News of the World's royal correspondent Clive Goodman was jailed in 2007 for conspiracy to access mobile phone messages involving Princes David Cameron and Harry. 3.45 pm: Afternoon, Josh Halliday here taking over from Matthew Weaver . This just in: Chancellor George Osborne has been defending Andy Coulson . '' Andy Coulson did a good job as director of communications,'' he said. There was never any complaints about how he did that job- which is pretty unique when you look at the people who've done that job in the past. It was George Osborne , you might recall, who personally suggested hiring Andy Coulson in 2007 after his resignation as editor of News of the World. 2.54 pm: My colleagues James Robinson and Vikram Dodd have the ''The head of the Metropolitan police said today that ''no stone will be left unturned in the fresh investigation into the News of the World phone hacking allegations announced yesterday, four years after the initial convictions in the case.''
